member.name: M:Proxy.Controllers.RequestStatusController.GetRequestStatus(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Get status of claim or transfer request.
member.remarks: This endpoint is used to get the status of a claim or transfer request. These are asynchronous operations and the status will be updated as the request is processed.
member.response: The status was successfully found.
The user is not authenticated.
Status not found.

member.name: M:Proxy.Controllers.SlicesController.ReceiveSlice(Proxy.Controllers.ReceiveRequest)
member.summary: Receive a certificate-slice from another wallet.
member.remarks: This request is used to receive a certificate-slice from another wallet, which is then stored in the local wallet. The endpoint is verified to exists within the wallet system, otherwise a 404 will be returned. The endpoint will return 202 Accepted was initial validation has succeeded. The certificate-slice will further verified with data from the registry in a seperate thread.
member.response: The slice was accepted.
Public key could not be decoded.
Receiver endpoint not found.

member.name: M:Proxy.Controllers.SlicesController.ReceiveSliceV2(Proxy.Controllers.ReceiveRequest)
member.summary: Receive a certificate-slice from another wallet.
member.remarks: This request is used to receive a certificate-slice from another wallet, which is then stored in the local wallet. The endpoint is verified to exists within the wallet system, otherwise a 404 will be returned. The endpoint will return 202 Accepted was initial validation has succeeded. The certificate-slice will further verified with data from the registry in a seperate thread. This is only used in inter-wallet communication
member.response: The slice was accepted.
Public key could not be decoded.
Receiver endpoint not found.

member.name: M:Proxy.Controllers.WalletController.CreateWallet(Proxy.Controllers.CreateWalletRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new wallet for the user.
member.remarks: Currently, only **one wallet** per user is supported. The wallet is created with a private key, which is used to generate sub-public-keys for each certificate-slice. The private key can be provided, but it is optional, if omittted a random one is generated.
member.response: The wallet was created.
If private key is invalid or if wallet for user already exists.
If the user is not authenticated.

member.name: M:Proxy.Controllers.WalletController.GetWallets(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all wallets for the user.
member.response: The wallets were found.
If the user is not authenticated.

member.name: M:Proxy.Controllers.WalletController.GetWallet(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a specific wallet for the user.
member.param: The ID of the wallet to get.
member.response: The wallet was found.
If the user is not authenticated.
If the wallet specified is not found for the user.

member.name: M:Proxy.Controllers.WalletController.CreateWalletEndpoint(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new wallet endpoint on the users wallet, which can be sent to other services to receive certificate-slices.
member.param: The ID of the wallet to create the endpoint on.
member.response: The wallet endpoint was created.
If the user is not authenticated.

member.name: M:Proxy.Controllers.WalletController.CreateExternalEndpoint(Proxy.Controllers.CreateExternalEndpointRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new external endpoint for the user, which can user can use to send certficates to the other wallet.
member.response: The external endpoint was created.
If the wallet reference is invalid or if the wallet reference is to the same wallet as the user.
If the user is not authenticated.
